hadith1.title: عند الاستيقاظ | Upon Waking
hadith1.summary: Beautiful supplication taught by Imam Zayn al-Abidin for beginning each day

steps.arabic: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ
steps.translation: Abu Abdullah (Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him) said:

steps.arabic: إِنَّ عَلِيَّ بْنَ اَلْحُسَيْنِ صَلَوَاتُ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ
steps.translation: "Verily, Ali ibn al-Husayn (prayers of Allah be upon him)
when morning came, would say:
'I begin this day
in the face of my forgetfulness and haste,

steps.arabic: بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ وَ مَا شَاءَ اَللَّهُ
steps.transliteration: Bismi llāhi wa mā shā'a llāh
steps.translation: [with] "In the name of Allah, and what Allah wills."
If a servant does this,
it suffices him for what he forgets during his day.'"

hadith2.title: دعاء الصباح | Morning Supplication
hadith2.summary: Powerful protection prayer taught by Imam Zayn al-Abidin for seeking divine shelter

steps.arabic: عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ السَّلَامُ قَالَ
steps.transliteration: ʿAn Abī ʿAbdillāhi ʿalayhi s-salāmu qāl
steps.translation: From Abu Abdullah (Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him), who said:

steps.arabic: كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ
steps.transliteration: Kāna ʿAliyyu bnu l-Ḥusayni ʿalayhimā s-salāmu yaqūl
steps.translation: "Ali ibn al-Husayn (peace be upon them both) used to say:

steps.arabic: مَا أُبَالِي إِذَا قُلْتُ هَذِهِ اَلْكَلِمَاتِ
steps.transliteration: Mā ubālī idhā qultu hādhihi l-kalimāt
steps.translation: 'I care not, when I utter these words,

steps.arabic: لَوِ اِجْتَمَعَ عَلَيَّ اَلْإِنْسُ وَ اَلْجِنُّ
steps.transliteration: Lawi jtamaʿa ʿalayya l-insu wa l-jinn
steps.translation: even if all humans and jinn were to gather against me:
"In the name of Allah, and by Allah,

steps.transliteration: Wa mina llāhi wa ilā llāh
steps.translation: and from Allah, and to Allah,
and in the path of Allah,
and upon the creed of the Messenger of Allah,
may Allah bless him and his family.
O Allah, to You I submit myself,
to You I turn my face,
to You I entrust my back,
and to You I surrender my affairs.
O Allah, protect me with the protection of faith

steps.arabic: مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ وَ مِنْ خَلْفِي
steps.transliteration: Min bayni yadayya wa min khalfī
steps.translation: from before me and behind me,

steps.transliteration: Wa ʿan yamīnī wa ʿan shimālī
steps.translation: from my right and my left,

steps.transliteration: Wa min fawqī wa min taḥtī
steps.translation: from above me and below me,
and from my front.

steps.arabic: وَ اِدْفَعْ عَنِّي بِحَوْلِكَ وَ قُوَّتِكَ
steps.transliteration: Wa dfaʿ ʿannī bi-ḥawlika wa quwwatik
steps.translation: And repel [harm] from me by Your power and strength,

steps.arabic: فَإِنَّهُ لاَ حَوْلَ وَ لاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِكَ
steps.transliteration: Fa-innahu lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā bik"'"
steps.translation: for there is no power nor strength except through You."'"

hadith3.title: عند الاستيقاظ | Morning Fragrance
hadith3.summary: On the spiritual benefits of applying fragrance at the beginning of the day

steps.arabic: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ رَفَعَهُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ
steps.transliteration: ʿAliyyu bnu Ibrāhīma rafaʿahu ilā Abī ʿAbdillāhi ʿalayhi s-salāmu qāl
steps.translation: Ali ibn Ibrahim raised it (in narration) to Abu Abdullah (al-Sadiq, peace be upon him), who said:
"Whoever applies fragrance at the beginning of the day,

steps.arabic: لَمْ يَزَلْ عَقْلُهُ مَعَهُ إِلَى اَللَّيْلِ
steps.transliteration: Lam yazal ʿaqluhu maʿahu ilā l-layl"
steps.translation: his intellect will remain with him until night."

steps.arabic: وَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ
steps.transliteration: Wa qāla qāla Abū ʿAbdillāhi ʿalayhi s-salām
steps.translation: And he (the Imam) said:
"The prayer of one who uses fragrance is superior
to seventy prayers without fragrance."

hadith1.title: وضوء | Imam Ali's Comprehensive Wudhu Supplication
hadith1.summary: Detailed narration of Imam Ali's wudhu practice with spiritual supplications for each step

steps.arabic: عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ السَّلاَمُ قَالَ:
steps.transliteration: ʿAn Abī ʿAbdillāhi ʿalayhi s-salāmu qāl:
steps.translation: From Abu Abdullah (Imam al-Sadiq), peace be upon him, who said:

steps.arabic: بَيْنَا أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ السَّلاَمُ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ جَالِساً مَعَ اِبْنِ اَلْحَنَفِيَّةِ إِذْ قَالَ يَا مُحَمَّدُ اِئْتِنِي بِإِنَاءٍ فِيهِ مَاءٌ أَتَوَضَّأْ لِلصَّلاَةِ
steps.transliteration: Baynā Amīru l-Muʾminīna ʿalayhi s-salāmu dhāta yawmin jālisan maʿa ibni l-Ḥanafiyyati idh qāla yā Muḥammadu iʾtinī bi-ināʾin fīhi māʾun atawaḍḍaʾu li-ṣ-ṣalāh
steps.translation: One day, the Commander of the Faithful (Imam Ali), peace be upon him, was sitting with Ibn al-Hanafiyyah when he said, "O Muhammad, bring me a vessel with water so I may perform ablution for prayer."

steps.arabic: فَأَتَاهُ مُحَمَّدٌ بِالْمَاءِ فَأَكْفَأَ بِيَدِهِ اَلْيُمْنَى عَلَى يَدِهِ اَلْيُسْرَى
steps.transliteration: Fa-atāhu Muḥammadun bi-l-māʾi fa-akfaʾa bi-yadihi l-yumnā ʿalā yadihi l-yusrā
steps.translation: Muhammad brought him the water. He poured water with his right hand onto his left hand,

steps.arabic: ثُمَّ قَالَ بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ اَلَّذِي جَعَلَ اَلْمَاءَ طَهُوراً وَ لَمْ يَجْعَلْهُ نَجِساً
steps.transliteration: Thumma qāla bi-smi llāhi l-ḥamdu li-llāhi l-ladhī jaʿala l-māʾa ṭahūran wa lam yajʿalhu najisā
steps.translation: Then he said: "In the name of Allah. Praise be to Allah, who made water purifying and not impure."
Then he cleansed himself (after relieving himself),

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ حَصِّنْ فَرْجِي وَ أَعِفَّهُ وَ اُسْتُرْ عَوْرَتِي وَ حَرِّمْنِي عَلَى اَلنَّارِ
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma ḥaṣṣin farjī wa aʿiffahu wa ustur ʿawratī wa ḥarrimnī ʿalā n-nār
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, safeguard my chastity, keep me pure, conceal my faults, and forbid me from the Fire."
He then rinsed his mouth,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ لَقِّنِّي حُجَّتِي يَوْمَ أَلْقَاكَ وَ أَطْلِقْ لِسَانِي بِذِكْرِكَ
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma laqqinnī ḥujjatī yawma alqāka wa aṭliq lisānī bi-dhikrika
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, grant me my argument on the day I meet You, and let my tongue flow with Your remembrance."
He then inhaled water into his nostrils,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ لاَ تُحَرِّمْ عَلَيَّ رِيحَ اَلْجَنَّةِ وَ اِجْعَلْنِي مِمَّنْ يَشَمُّ رِيحَهَا وَ رَوْحَهَا وَ رَيْحَانَهَا وَ طِيبَهَا
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma lā tuḥarrim ʿalayya rīḥa l-jannati wa ijʿalnī mimman yashammu rīḥahā wa rawḥahā wa rayḥānahā wa ṭībahā
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, do not deprive me of the fragrance of Paradise, and make me among those who inhale its fragrance, bliss, flowers, and sweetness."
Then he washed his face,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ بَيِّضْ وَجْهِي يَوْمَ تَسْوَدُّ فِيهِ اَلْوُجُوهُ وَ لاَ تُسَوِّدْ وَجْهِي يَوْمَ تَبْيَضُّ فِيهِ اَلْوُجُوهُ
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma bayyiḍ wajhī yawma taswaddu fīhi l-wujūhu wa lā tusawwid wajhī yawma tabyaḍḍu fīhi l-wujūh
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, brighten my face on the day when faces turn black, and do not darken my face on the day when faces turn white."
Then he washed his right hand,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِنِي كِتَابِي بِيَمِينِي وَ اَلْخُلْدَ فِي اَلْجِنَانِ بِيَسَارِي وَ حَاسِبْنِي حِسٰاباً يَسِيراً
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma aʿṭinī kitābī bi-yamīnī wa l-khulda fī l-jināni bi-yasārī wa ḥāsibnī ḥisāban yasīrā
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, grant me my record in my right hand, eternal life in Paradise in my left, and judge me with an easy reckoning."
Then he washed his left hand,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ لاَ تُعْطِنِي كِتَابِي بِشِمَالِي وَ لاَ تَجْعَلْهَا مَغْلُولَةً إِلَى عُنُقِي وَ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ مُقَطَّعَاتِ اَلنِّيرَانِ
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma lā tuʿṭinī kitābī bi-shimālī wa lā tajʿalhā maghlūlatan ilā ʿunuqī wa aʿūdhu bika min muqaṭṭaʿāti n-nīrān
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, do not give me my record in my left hand, nor bind it to my neck, and I seek refuge in You from the flames of Hellfire."
Then he wiped his head,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ غَشِّنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ وَ بَرَكَاتِكَ وَ عَفْوِكَ
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma ghashshinī bi-raḥmatika wa barakātika wa ʿafwik
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, envelop me in Your mercy, blessings, and forgiveness."
Then he wiped his feet,

steps.arabic: فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ ثَبِّتْنِي عَلَى اَلصِّرَاطِ يَوْمَ تَزِلُّ فِيهِ اَلْأَقْدَامُ وَ اِجْعَلْ سَعْيِي فِيمَا يُرْضِيكَ عَنِّي يَا أَرْحَمَ اَلرَّاحِمِينَ
steps.transliteration: Fa-qāla llāhumma thabbitnī ʿalā ṣ-ṣirāṭi yawma tazillu fīhi l-aqdāmu wa ijʿal saʿyī fīmā yurḍīka ʿannī yā arḥama r-rāḥimīn
steps.translation: And said: "O Allah, keep me steadfast on the Bridge (Sirat) on the day when feet slip, and let my efforts be in what pleases You, O Most Merciful of the Merciful."

steps.arabic: ثُمَّ رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ فَنَظَرَ إِلَى مُحَمَّدٍ فَقَالَ يَا مُحَمَّدُ مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ مِثْلَ وُضُوئِي وَ قَالَ مِثْلَ قَوْلِي خَلَقَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ كُلِّ قَطْرَةٍ مَلَكاً يُقَدِّسُهُ وَ يُسَبِّحُهُ وَ يُكَبِّرُهُ وَ يَكْتُبُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى لَهُ ثَوَابَ ذَلِكَ إِلَى يَوْمِ اَلْقِيَامَةِ
steps.transliteration: Thumma rafaʿa raʾsahu fa-naẓara ilā Muḥammadin fa-qāla yā Muḥammadu man tawaḍḍaʾa mithla wuḍūʾī wa qāla mithla qawlī khalaqa llāhu ʿazza wa jalla min kulli qaṭratin malakan yuqaddisuhu wa yusabbiḥuhu wa yukabbiruhu wa yaktubu llāhu taʿālā lahu thawāba dhālika ilā yawmi l-qiyāmah
steps.translation: Then he raised his head and looked at Muhammad and said, "O Muhammad, whoever performs ablution like mine and recites these words like I did, Allah the Almighty will create from every drop [of water] an angel who glorifies, praises, and exalts Him, and Allah will record its reward for him until the Day of Resurrection."

supplication1.title: الدعاء بالتوبة | Supplication on Confession
supplication1.summary: Heartfelt prayer acknowledging human imperfection and seeking divine mercy

steps.translation: And among his prayers (upon him be peace)

steps.arabic: فِي الِاعْتِرَافِ وَطَلَبِ التَّوْبَةِ إِلَى اللَّهِ تَعَالَى
steps.transliteration: Fī l-i'tirāfi wa-ṭalabi t-tawbati ilā llāhi ta'ālā
steps.translation: in confession and seeking repentance from Allah, the Exalted:

steps.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّهُ يَحْجُبُنِي عَنْ مَسْأَلَتِكَ خِلَالٌ ثَلَاثٌ، وَتَحْدُونِي عَلَيْهَا خَلَّةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
steps.transliteration: Allāhumma innahu yaḥjubunī 'an mas'alatika khilālun thalāth, wa-taḥdūnī 'alayhā khallatun wāḥidah
steps.translation: O Allah, three traits prevent me from asking You, yet one trait compels me:

steps.arabic: يَحْجُبُنِي أَمْرٌ أَمَرْتَ بِهِ فَأَبْطَأْتُ عَنْهُ
steps.translation: What prevents me is a command You ordered, but I delayed in obeying;
a prohibition You forbade, but I hastened toward it;

steps.arabic: وَنِعْمَةٌ أَنْعَمْتَ بِهَا عَلَيَّ فَقَصَّرْتُ فِي شُكْرِهَا
steps.transliteration: Wa-ni'matun an'amta bihā 'alayya fa-qaṣṣartu fī shukrihā
steps.translation: and a blessing You bestowed, but I fell short in gratitude.

steps.arabic: وَيَحْدُونِي عَلَى مَسْأَلَتِكَ تَفَضُّلُكَ عَلَى مَنْ أَقْبَلَ بِوَجْهِهِ إِلَيْكَ
steps.transliteration: Wa-yaḥdūnī 'alā mas'alatika tafaḍḍuluka 'alā man aqbala bi-wajhihi ilayka
steps.translation: What compels me is Your grace toward those who turn to You
and approach You with good hope.
For all Your benevolence is grace,
and all Your favors are initiated by You alone.

steps.arabic: فَهَا أَنَا ذَا، يَا إِلَهِي وَاقِفٌ بِبَابِ عِزِّكَ وُقُوفَ المُسْتَسْلِمِ الذَّلِيلِ
steps.transliteration: Fa-hā anā dhā, yā ilāhī wāqifun bi-bābi 'izzika wuqūfa l-mustaslimi dh-dhalīl
steps.translation: Here I stand, my God, at the door of Your might--humbled and surrendered--

steps.arabic: وَسَائِلُكَ عَلَى الحَيَاءِ مِنِّي سُؤَالَ البَائِسِ المُعِيلِ
steps.transliteration: Wa-sā'iluka 'alā l-ḥayā'i minnī su'āla l-bā'isi l-mu'īl
steps.translation: asking You despite my shame, like a destitute beggar.
